metadata.title: CVE-2016-6329 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: OpenVPN, when using a 64-bit block cipher, makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain cleartext data via a birthday attack against a long-duration encrypted session, as demonstrated by an HTTP-over-OpenVPN session using Blowfish in CBC mode, aka a "Sweet32" attack.

notes.note: mdeslaur> openvpn 2.3 and earlier use BF-CBC by default unless the cipher is specified manually. 2.3.12 was modified to display a warning if a 64-bit cipher is selected. Since this is just a warning, downgrading priority to low sbeattie> fixed in 2.4.0

criterions.comment: openvpn package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.0-4ubuntu1').
